title: References (Part 23)
content:
References

References (Part 23)

Continued References [297-310]

  • [297] Wanjun Zhong et al. - Memorybank: Enhancing large language models with long-term memory (2023)
  • [298] Zora Zhiruo Wang et al. - Agent workflow memory (2024)
  • [299] Jizhan Fang et al. - Lightmem: Lightweight and efficient memory-augmented generation (2025)
  • [300] Jiayan Nan et al. - Nemori: Self-organizing agent memory inspired by cognitive science (2025)
  • [301] Qizheng Zhang et al. - Agentic context engineering: Evolving contexts for self-improving language models (2025)
  • [302] Siru Ouyang et al. - Reasoningbank: Scaling agent self-evolving with reasoning memory (2025)
  • [303] Mirae Suzgun et al. - Dynamic cheatsheet: Test-time learning with adaptive memory (2025)
  • [304] Kevin Lin et al. - Sleep-time compute: Beyond inference scaling at test-time (2025)
  • [305] Darren Edge et al. - From local to global: A graph rag approach to query-focused summarization (2024)
  • [306] Preston Rasmussen et al. - Zep: A temporal knowledge graph architecture for agent memory (2025)
  • [307] Zaijing Li et al. - Optimus-1: Hybrid multimodal memory empowered agents excel in long-horizon tasks (2024)
  • [308] Tomoyuki Kagaya et al. - Rap: Retrieval-augmented planning with contextual memory for multimodal llm agents (2024)
  • [309] Lin Long et al. - Seeing, listening, remembering, and reasoning: A multimodal agent with long-term memory (2025)
  • [310] Yuanchen Bei et al. - Mem-gallery: Benchmarking multimodal long-term conversational memory for mllm agents (2026)

Analysis & Explanation

Agent Memory Systems

Memory Architectures
  • MemoryBank: Long-term memory enhancement
  • Workflow Memory: Task-specific memory
  • Graph RAG: Knowledge graph memory
